words.definition: If something goes ashore, it goes from water to the land.
words.example: After a long day of fishing, Glen pulled his boat ashore, so it wouldn’t float away.

words.definition: To contradict means to state the opposite of what someone else has.
words.example: Ken was always fighting with his little sister because she kept contradicting him.

words.definition: A counterpart is something that is very similar to something else in what it does.
words.example: Our manager will meet our rival company’s counterpart later today.

words.definition: When something or someone is devoid of a thing, they are missing it.
words.example: The movie was devoid of any entertaining moments.

words.definition: To diverge means to go in a different direction from a common point.
words.example: The path diverged into two different roads.

words.definition: To elude means to avoid being caught by something.
words.example: The mouse eluded the cat by hiding in the tiny hole.

words.definition: An embryo is a human or animal that is still growing inside its mother.
words.example: The ultrasound showed that the embryo was developing normally.

words.definition: To fend off something means to push it away and avoid it.
words.example: The city had to fend off the invaders.

words.definition: When something is fictitious, it is made up and not real.
words.example: The characters in the book are all fictitious.

words.definition: A gazette is a newspaper.
words.example: The news about the new school was published in the local gazette.

words.definition: If something is homogeneous, it is made up of things which are all the same.
words.example: The population of the town was very homogeneous.

words.definition: To obstruct something means to get in its way.
words.example: The fallen tree obstructed the road.

words.definition: To plunge means to move or make something move suddenly forwards and downwards.
words.example: The car plunged into the river.

words.definition: To prolong something means to make it last longer.
words.example: The meeting was prolonged by several long questions.

words.definition: To publicize is to make something known to a lot of people.
words.example: The company publicized its new product on TV.

words.definition: If something is sparse, there is only a small amount of it spread over a large area.
words.example: Vegetation is sparse in the desert.

words.definition: A surplus is an extra amount of something.
words.example: The government had a budget surplus this year.

words.definition: To theorize means to develop an idea about how something works.
words.example: Scientists theorized that the universe is expanding.

words.definition: To verify means to find out if something is true.
words.example: She verified the information before she reported it.

words.definition: If something is vigorous, it is full of energy.
words.example: He gave a vigorous speech to the crowd.
